snippet: Thanks partly to Anheuser-Busch, alcoholism is an epidemic on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation. Suddenly that Bud doesn’t taste so good.
abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column criticizes Anheuser-Busch and other brewers for providing beer to liquor stores in Whiteclay, Neb, where Native Americans from Pine Ridge reservation go to purchase alcohol, which is prohibited on the reservation; asserts that by providing the town with alcohol, the brewers are contributing to an alcoholism epidemic in the reservation; calls for a boycott of Anheuser-Busch beers. (M)
lead_paragraph: WHITECLAY, Neb. AFTER seeing Anheuser-Busch's devastating exploitation of American Indians, I'm done with its beer.
